story.title: The Christmas Sweater - Episode 1
story.storyDescription: Ever since her mother‚Äôs death, Noelle hasn‚Äôt wanted to go home for the holidays. But perhaps a bit of holiday magic is all she needs‚Ä¶
story.creator: web-uploader
story.postPaywallNotification: Noelle is about to become embarrassed big time! Find out how in THE CHRISTMAS SWEATER.

messages.text: Come on, Noelle. You have to come home for Christmas.
I told you no and that‚Äôs the end of it.
I can‚Äôt handle Christmas with Dad.
I‚Äôm not as tough as you.
Seriously? You‚Äôre using that excuse?
You‚Äôre stronger than me, Noelle. You‚Äôre stronger than anyone in our family.
But I can‚Äôt bear to see Dad with‚Ä¶her.
Mom is dead, Noelle. She‚Äôs been dead for five years.
You should be happy that Dad is dating someone else.
Yeah, but did he have to choose Beatrice?
It‚Äôs disgusting. That woman used to babysit us whenever Mom and Dad had a big case.
Ew, stop! You act like Beatrice is some young vixen.
She‚Äôs a family friend! A good one.
I don‚Äôt believe that anymore.
She probably had her eye on Dad during our whole childhood.
Maybe she was waiting for the day when the stress of work got between the two of them‚Ä¶
Noelle, stop it! It‚Äôs Christmastime ‚Äî have a heart!
If you‚Äôd just listen to the story of how Dad and Beatrice got together‚Ä¶
Um, no thank you!
I can‚Äôt because I DO have a heart ‚Äî it loves and remembers Mom.
DON‚ÄôT throw that in my face.
I miss Mom every single day.
And unlike you, I couldn‚Äôt run away to Florida after she died.
I didn‚Äôt run away!
Yes, you did.
Look, it‚Äôs Christmas. I don‚Äôt want to fight.
Can you stop it with this ‚Äúit‚Äôs Christmas‚Äù garbage?
Bad things happen during Christmas too, remember?
That‚Äôs when Mom died.
Noelle, please. I remember.
Look, just‚Ä¶please come home for Christmas.
It‚Äôs going to be a very important one for our family this year.
What‚Äôs that supposed to mean?
Hello?!
Ten minutes later, Noelle groans.
Her sister still hasn‚Äôt responded to her text.
She checks her emails at work.
Nothing.
She checks her phone again.
Nothing.
No messages from anyone, because her friends are all traveling for the holidays‚Ä¶
And because her love life is non-existent‚Ä¶
There aren‚Äôt any messages from hot guys either.
Sighing, Noelle clicks Maria‚Äôs name and their text conversation pops up.
Fine. I‚Äôll come home.
Great!! I already bought you a ticket.
See you soon üéÖ ü§ó
Noelle gets a ping on her phone.
It‚Äôs her plane ticket‚Ä¶and the flight leaves in two hours!
Noelle rolls her eyes, stuffs some clothes into a duffle bag and calls an Uber.
One hour later‚Ä¶
Noelle makes it through security with plenty of time.
She heads to the bar and orders herself a warm spiked eggnog, to prep for the journey home.
But when the bartender places the mug in front of her‚Ä¶
A guy‚Äôs broad hand darts out to take it before she can.
Excuse me! That‚Äôs my eggnog.
I‚Äôm sorry. I thought I‚Äôd ordered mine before you, but you can have it.
Ladies first.
Noelle feels herself blush.
Oh! You ordered eggnog too?
No whip, extra cinnamon.
Spiked?
I‚Äôm afraid so. I always get a little nervous on airplanes.
Me too.
The guy puts out his hand.
I‚Äôm Lawrence.
Noelle eyes him warily before shaking it.
Noelle.
Like Christmas day, right?
Noelle rolls her eyes.
Ugh, yes. Unfortunately.
Lawrence gives her a strange look so she clears her throat.
She pushes the cup of eggnog towards him.
Well anyway‚Ä¶I think this is yours. I ordered mine with whip.
Lawrence laughs easily.
There‚Äôs something about the way the sound emanates from his body‚Ä¶
It loosens Noelle‚Äôs muscles more than any warm holiday drink ever could.
So do you prefer whip, or extra whip?
Noelle decides to take the bait.
It is Christmastime, after all.
Extra whip, obviously.
Excellent. Now I don‚Äôt have to feel bad about taking this drink from a beautiful woman.
To Noelle‚Äôs dismay, she feels herself blush again.
She is usually in control of every situation and all of her reactions‚Äî
It‚Äôs become second nature to her since her mom died.
Back then, even the slightest kind word about her mom would send her to tears.
And it was an act of self-preservation to keep herself constantly in check.
Noelle sneaks a glance at Lawrence and then ducks down her head to hide her emotions.
She grabs her phone as a security blanket.
Ugh, Maria ‚Äî this guy tried to steal my eggnog at the airport.
What guy? Is he hot?!
Are you seriously trying to play matchmaker from 1500 miles away?
That depends on how hot he is.
Fine. He‚Äôs totally hot. Happy?
YES! Omg, what‚Äôs his name? Does he live in Florida??
Get his number!
Noelle is about to text her sister back when she hears Lawrence clear his throat.
Totally hot, huh?
Oh my god! You weren‚Äôt supposed to see that!
Lawrence raises his hands in apology, a sparkle in his eye.
Sorry, I have a special talent for reading upside down.
Noelle feels her cheeks grow redder.
But I appreciate the compliment.
He writes something on a napkin and slides it across the counter.
And think you should take my number.
Noelle‚Äôs mouth falls open.
But before she can speak, Lawrence downs his eggnog, gets up, and walks away.
It takes a full minute for Noelle to come to her senses.
She drinks her eggnog slowly, trying to put the infuriating stranger out of her head.
When she finally loses herself in the swirls of cinnamon and sugar‚Ä¶
She suddenly hears her name blaring over the airport PA system.
The flight attendant is paging HER ‚Äì the plane is about to take off!
Oh F&*K!
There‚Äôs an elderly couple sitting next to Noelle in matching Christmas sweaters.
They scowl at Noelle‚Äôs language as she jumps up from her seat.
She tries not to roll her eyes as she smacks a twenty on the bar.
Because, really? Tacky Christmas sweaters?
At a run, Noelle barely gets through the gate before the attendant closes it.
She tries not to make eye contact with the irritated passengers who glare at her‚Äî
And her overflowing duffle bag.
Noelle finally makes it to her seat and gasps.
Are you kidding me right now?!
Her cheeks flush with embarrassment, again.
She didn‚Äôt mean to yell that out loud.
But sitting there in her seat, flashing his devastatingly handsome smile‚Ä¶
Is the hot guy from the airport bar.
